choices.name: Get started with research for your Oregon ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Oregon ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine records for Oregon research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Oregon research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Oregon Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Get an overview of Oregon research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Oregon Overview—4:27

  3. Follow this research study for Oregon ancestors, from 1850-1903.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Oregon Research, 1850-1903

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Oregon research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Oregon Resources
    ☆ AC—Oregon State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the Oregon Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Oregon Record Finder

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Oregon in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Oregon

    2. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Oregon in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Oregon


Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Oregon in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Oregon

  2. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Oregon in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Oregon

1. Explore Oregon historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Oregon History

  2. Explore Oregon history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Oregon

  3. Learn about Oregon history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Oregon History

choices.name: Learn about Oregon archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Oregon archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Oregon Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Oregon State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Oregon.
  3. Explore Oregon Dept. of Archives collection.
  4. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Oregon genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  5. Search for ☆free online books on Oregon research on the FamilySearch site.
  6. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Oregon ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Oregon city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Oregon Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Oregon city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Oregon city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Oregon ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Oregon city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

QUIKLinks

hidden.content:
• Find obituaries for Oregon ancestors.
  • Find death records and death indexes for Oregon ancestors.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for obituary and death records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆AccessGenealogy site for Oregon cemetery records by county.
  2. Explore the ObituariesHelp site for Oregon obituaries.
  3. Explore The Ancestor Hunt for obituaries.
  4. Search for obituaries by county on the Newspaperobituaries.net site.
  5. Find additional resources for Oregon obituaries on the ☆Linkpendium site.
Oregon Death Records
  1. Learn how to find Oregon death records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: How to Find Oregon Death Records

  2. Explore the Ancestors at Rest site for Oregon death records.
  3. Explore Oregon death records, indexes, and obituaries.
  4. Explore additional links for Oregon death records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Oregon County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Oregon.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Oregon Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Oregon Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Oregon Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Oregon Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. West Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Oregon.

Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Oregon research.
  2. Explore the Oregon research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Oregon research.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Oregon in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Oregon Societies

  2. Explore the Oregon Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Genealogical Forum of Oregon site.
  4. Explore Oregon genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Oregon.
